Let $A_1,A_2,\ldots$ be an infinite collection of infinite sets of integers, say $A_i=\{a_{i1}<a_{i2}<\cdots\}$. Does there exist some $f:\mathbb{N}\to\{-1,1\}$ such that\[\max_{m, 1\leq i\leq d} \left\lvert \sum_{1\leq j\leq m} f(a_{ij})\right\rvert \ll_d 1\]for all $d\geq 1$?



Erd\H{o}s remarks 'it seems certain that the answer is affirmative'. This was solved by Beck \cite{Be81}. Recently Beck \cite{Be17} proved that one can replace $\ll_d 1$ with $\ll d^{4+\epsilon}$ for any $\epsilon>0$.




References


[Be17] Beck, J\'{o}zsef, A discrepancy problem: balancing infinite dimensional vectors. Number theory-Diophantine problems, uniform distribution
and applications (2017), 61-82.

[Be81] Beck, J\'{o}zsef, Balancing families of integer sequences. Combinatorica (1981), 209-216.
